title: Quiz - ReportsTap -22nd to 30th September 2023 PART 1
instruction: The report “Review of Maritime Transport 2023” informed that Global shipping continues to confront multiple challenges, including heightened trade policy and geopolitical tensions and is dealing with changes in globalization patterns. Additionally, shipping must transition to a more sustainable future, decarbonize and embrace digitalization. Being at the intersection of these forces will influence how the sector adapts to the evolving operational and regulatory landscape while continuing to effectively service global trade.

quiz.text: Which of the following organisations has recently (September 2023), released the report “The growth of ultra-processed foods in India”?
options: International Medical Corps
World Health Assembly
Global Health Council
World Health Organizations
World Bank

quiz.text: According to the recently (September 2023), released report “The growth of ultra-processed foods in India”, India’s ultra-processed food sector grew at a compound annual growth rate of ______________ per cent in retail sales value from 2011 to 2021.
options: 14.37
13.37
12.37
11.37
9.37

quiz.text: According to the recently (September 2023), released report “The growth of ultra-processed foods in India” " in terms of retail sales volume, the share of ____________ was the highest during 2011-2021.
options: Ready-made and convenience food
Salty snacks
Chocolate and sugar confectionery
Beverages
Breakfast cereals

quiz.text: Consider the following recommendations given by the recently (September 2023) released “The growth of ultra-processed foods in India” report.1. Have nutrition-linked cesses2. Implement the labelling guidelines3. Ensure the provision of healthy food under the food safety net programmes4. Build awareness about healthy eating habits and the harmful impacts of unhealthy eatingWhich of the following statements is/are incorrect?
options: Only 1
Only 2
Only 3
Both 1 and 4
None

quiz.text: Which of the following organizations has recently (September 2023), the report mentioned in the above passage?
options: International Monetary Fund
World Bank Group
World Economic Forum
Reserve Bank of India
Asian Development Bank

quiz.text: According to the recently (September 2023), released report mentioned in the above passage, about _________ adults remain financially excluded, over 50 percent of which are in seven emerging markets and developing economies (EMDEs).
options: 1.6 billion
1.5 billion
1.4 billion
1.3 billion
1.2 billion

quiz.text: According to the recently (September 2023), released report mentioned in the above passage, in India, the implementation of DPIs such as Aadhaar (a foundational digital ID system), along with the Jan Dhan bank accounts and mobile phones, is considered to have played a critical role in moving ownership of transaction accounts from approximately 25% of adults in 2008 to over ________  percent in 2023.
options: 50
60
70
80
90

quiz.text: Consider the following recommendations given by the recently (September 2023), released report mentioned in the above passage.1. Implementing appropriate regulation, supervision, and oversight2. Ensuring sound and effective institutional and governance arrangements by DPIs3. Protecting the banks from insolvencyWhich of the following recommendations is/are correct?
options: Only 1
Only 2
Only 3
Both 1 and 2
All of the above

quiz.text: Which of the following organizations has recently (September 2023) released the report mentioned in the above passage?
options: World Bank and the United Nations Population Fund
Asian Development Bank and the United Nations Population Fund
International Institute for Population Sciences and the United Nations Population Fund
International Institute for Population Sciences and World Bank
International Institute for Population Sciences and Asian Development Bank

quiz.text: Consider the following statements regarding the recently (September 2023) released report mentioned in the above passage.1. 1.1 billion (13.9% of the Global population) people aged 60 years or above2. The number of older persons in the world is likely to double to 2.1 billion by 2030 (22% of the total population)3. In the Developed world the share of older persons will increase from 26% in 2022 to 50% in 2050Which of the following statements is/are correct?
options: Only 1
Only 2
Only 3
Both 1 and 2
Both 2 and 3

quiz.text: Consider the following statements regarding the recently (September 2023) released report mentioned in the above passage.1. Elderly in India’s population will double by 20502. In India, during 2000 and 2022 elderly grew by 134% 3. In India, during 2022-2050 elderly population will grow at 103%Which of the following statements is/are incorrect?
options: Only 1
Only 2
Only 3
Both 1 and 2
Both 2 and 3

quiz.text: Consider the following statements regarding the recently (September 2023) released report mentioned in the above passage.1. In India, 40% of elderly people did not have any income2. In India, over 18.7% elderly are in the poorest quintile3. In India women have higher life expectancy at the age of 60 and at 80, when compared to menWhich of the following statements is/are correct?
options: Only 1
Only 2
Only 3
Both 1 and 2
Both 2 and 3

quiz.text: According to the recently (September 2023) released report mentioned in the above passage, which of the following states has the highest proportion of senior citizens of all states?
options: Uttar Pradesh
Kerala
Bihar
Gujarat
Sikkim

quiz.text: Indian banks are expected to attract increasing global investment from investors looking for better returns as higher credit growth, improved margins and stable asset quality have boosted the prospects of the lenders, according to the recently (September 2023) released S&P Global Market Intelligence report, which informed that total market value of Foreign institutional investors (FII) holdings in Indian banks increased to ___________ as of June 30, from ₹7.71 trillion a year earlier.
options: ₹11.36 trillion
₹10.36 trillion
₹9.36 trillion
₹8.36 trillion
₹7.36 trillion

quiz.text: Consider the following statements regarding the recently (September 2023) released S&P Global Market Intelligence report.1. Top investees for foreign institutional investors (FIIs) include ICICI Bank Ltd., HDFC Bank Ltd. and Kotak Mahindra Bank Ltd2. Top foreign investors in Indian banks by market value are Capital Research and Management Co., BlackRock Inc, and Singapore’s GIC Private Ltd.3. 93.5% of FII holdings were concentrated in India's largest public-sector banksWhich of the following statements is/are correct?
options: Only 1
Only 2
Both 1 and 2
Only 3
Both 2 and 3

quiz.text: Which of the following organizations has recently (September 2023) released the report mentioned in the above passage?
options: World Intellectual Property Organization
World Economic Forum

United Nations Economic and Social Council

quiz.text: Consider the following statements regarding the recently (September 2023), released Global Innovation Index (GII) mentioned in the above passage.1. Index is topped by the Sweden with a score of 67.6 2. India has been ranked at the 40th Spot with a score of 38.13. Last rank has been given to the Niger, with a score of 10.3Which of the following statements is/are incorrect?
options: Only 1
Only 2
Only 3
Both 1 and 3
Both 2 and 3

quiz.text: According to the recently (September 2023), released Global Innovation Index, mentioned in the above passage, India Ranks _______ among 37 lower-middle-income economies and is the top innovation performer among the 10 economies in Central and Southern Asia
options: Last
1st
2nd
3rd
4th

quiz.text: Consider the following statements regarding the recently (September 2023), released Global Innovation Index (GII) mentioned in the above passage.1. The theme of this year's Global Innovation Index (GII) is “Innovation Amidst Certainty”.2. China, the sole middle-income economy within the top 30 3. NITI Aayog hosted the virtual launch of the GII 2023Which of the following statements is/are correct?
options: Only 1
Only 2
Both 2 and 3
Both 1 and 2
None of the above

quiz.text: Public Debt Management report, which was recently (September 2023) released gives an account of the public debt management and cash management operations during the quarter and provides detailed information on various aspects of debt management. Which of the following organizations releases it?
options: Reserve Bank of India
Ministry of Finance
NITI Aayog
State Bank of India
International Monetary Fund

quiz.text: According to the recently (September 2023), released Public Debt Management April-June 2023 (Q1 FY24), total gross liabilities (including liabilities under the ‘Public Account’) of the Government, as per provisional data, increased marginally to ₹1,59,53,703 crore at end- June 2023 from ₹1,56,08,634 crore at end-March 2023, of which Public debt accounted for ____________ of total gross liabilities during the quarter.
options: 59.5%
69.5%
79.5%
89.5%
99.5%

quiz.text: Which of the following organization has recently (September 2023) released the report mentioned in the above passage?
options: International Maritime Organization
United Nations Conference on Trade and Development
World Trade Organization
World Bank
World Customs Organization

quiz.text: Consider the following statements regarding recently (September 2023), released report mentioned in the above passage.1. Global maritime shipping volumes fell by 0.4% in 20222. 60% of the global fleet primarily uses conventional fuels 3. Decarbonizing the global fleet by 2050 may necessitate annual investments ranging from $8 billion to $28 billionWhich of the following statements is/are incorrect?
options: Only 1
Only 2
Only 3
Both 1 and 2
Both 1 and 3

quiz.text: Consider the following statements regarding recently (September 2023), released report mentioned in the above passage.1. The Theme of “Review of Maritime Transport 2023” report is “Towards a Green and Speedy Transition”.2. Shipping industry accounts for 80% of global trade volume3. Shipping industry accounts for 3% of total greenhouse gas emissionsWhich of the following statements is/are correct?
